SEARCH
Package com.hexcore.todo

Class TodoItem

java.lang.Object
com.hexcore.todo.TodoItem
public class TodoItem extends Object
Represents a single todo item with essential attributes and management capabilities. This class encapsulates the core details of a task or todo item, including its title, description, and expiry date. It provides methods for checking expiration status, retrieving item details, and updating task information.

Key Features:

  • Tracks title, description, and expiry date for a todo item
  • Supports checking if an item has expired
  • Provides getter and setter methods for item attributes
  • Includes validation for expiry date updates

Usage Example: 

 LocalDate futureDate = LocalDate.now().plusDays(7);
 TodoItem task = new TodoItem("Complete Project", "Finish development", futureDate);
 
 // Check if task is expired
 boolean isExpired = task.expired();
 
 // Update task description
 task.setDescription("Finalize project documentation");

Since:
2024-12-12

  • Method Details

    • expired

      public boolean expired()
      Checks if the to-do item has expired.
      Returns:
      true if the current date is after the expiry date, false otherwise

    • getTitle

    • getExpiryDate

      public String getExpiryDate()
      Retrieves the expiry date of the to-do item as a formatted string.
      Returns:
      the formatted expiry date in the format "d MMM uuuu" (e.g., "20 Dec 2024")

      public void updateExpiryDate(LocalDate newDate)
      Updates the expiry date of the to-do item.
      Parameters:
      newDate - the new expiry date
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if newDate is in the past
